subject: Biology

overview.description: Advanced biology curriculum for gifted students, emphasizing molecular biology, biochemistry, genetics, evolution, and cutting-edge research in biological sciences

learning_objectives: Master advanced concepts in molecular and cellular biology
Understand biochemical processes and metabolic pathways
Apply genetics and evolutionary principles to complex problems
Design and conduct sophisticated biological experiments
Prepare for biology olympiads and university-level research

units.title: Advanced Molecular Biology and Biochemistry
learning_outcomes: Understand molecular mechanisms of cellular processes
Analyze protein structure and function relationships
Apply biochemical principles to metabolic pathways
Connect molecular biology to cellular function

lessons.title: Protein Structure and Function Analysis
objectives: Understand protein folding and structural hierarchy
Analyze enzyme kinetics and regulation mechanisms
Connect protein structure to biological function

activities.description: Explore 3D protein structures using molecular modeling software
Analyze enzyme kinetics data and determine kinetic parameters
Investigate how mutations affect protein structure and function
Connect to current protein research and drug design

cross_curricular_connections: Chemistry: Organic chemistry and reaction mechanisms

units.title: Advanced Genetics and Genomics
learning_outcomes: Analyze gene regulation and expression patterns
Connect genetics to evolution and biodiversity

lessons.title: Gene Regulation and Epigenetics
objectives: Apply bioinformatics tools to analyze gene expression

activities.description: Analyze gene expression data using bioinformatics tools
Investigate gene regulation mechanisms in different cell types
Explore epigenetic modifications and their effects
Discuss applications in medicine and biotechnology

cross_curricular_connections: Computer Science: Bioinformatics and data analysis

units.title: Evolutionary Biology and Biodiversity
learning_outcomes: Apply population genetics and evolutionary theory
Analyze biodiversity patterns and conservation biology
Connect evolution to ecology and environmental science

lessons.title: Molecular Evolution and Phylogenetic Analysis
objectives: Understand molecular clocks and evolutionary rates
Apply comparative genomics to evolutionary questions

activities.description: Construct phylogenetic trees using molecular data
Investigate molecular evolution rates and divergence times
Compare genomes to understand evolutionary relationships
Discuss implications for understanding life's diversity

cross_curricular_connections: Mathematics: Statistical methods and tree analysis

units.title: Advanced Ecology and Environmental Biology
learning_outcomes: Understand ecosystem dynamics and energy flow
Apply mathematical models to ecological problems
Analyze environmental impacts and conservation strategies
Connect ecology to global environmental challenges

lessons.title: Ecosystem Modeling and Mathematical Ecology
objectives: Apply mathematical models to population dynamics

activities.description: Model population dynamics using differential equations
Run ecosystem simulations and analyze outcomes
Analyze real ecological data from field studies
Apply models to conservation biology problems

cross_curricular_connections: Environmental Science: Climate change and sustainability

molecular_biology_techniques: DNA extraction, PCR, and gel electrophoresis
advanced_experiments: Ecological field studies and data collection

formative_assessments: Weekly laboratory reports and data analysis

textbooks: Molecular Biology of the Cell (University level)
equipment: Field study and ecological monitoring equipment

university_preparation.biomedical_sciences: Strong foundation for medical and health sciences
university_preparation.biotechnology: Molecular biology and genetic engineering background
university_preparation.bioinformatics: Computational and analytical skills for biology
